Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand's underdogs tag at every World Cup is as perennial as it is perplexing.
Despite this stellar record, few expected them to make it out of the group that also featured England and hosts Australia, never mind topping it.
Pakistan, meanwhile, evoked the spirit of their 1992 World Cup triumph where they qualified for the semi-finals despite winning just one of their first five games and went on to lift the cup.
Pakistan hold the edge over New Zealand in their T20 head-to-head record, having won 17 of the 28 matches.
In the past year, the two have crossed paths numerous times. In their Super 12 tie at the World Cup last year, Pakistan comprehensively defeated New Zealand by five wickets.
But Kane Williamson will take encouragement from the fact that Pakistan has lost each of its last three semi-finals in the tournament
Miscellaneous Highlights: Australia’s pitches have been perfectly suited for the formidable pace attacks of both sides.
The semi-final will hinge on the teams’ batting.
New Zealand’s top order is strewn with firepower in Glenn Phillips, Finn Allen and Devon Conway.
Pakistan’s star openers Mohammad Rizwan and Babar Azam have so far struggled for fluency.
And then there is the recent discovery that is Mohammad Haris.
